Reviews.Content: Cheap And Cheerful We stayed at the jolly for two nights in June. Check in was very fast and we stayed on the top floor. Upon first entering the room we were quite pleased, nice bathroom and bed. Huge terrace outside with great views. The air con worked fine. However it is extremely noisy at night, very loud music from outside which we could hear from the top floor and through double glazing!! Also we came away with a number of bites, we had insect spray but even that didn't work so perhaps bed bugs are to blame. I would probably advise not to stay here, location is about a 15 minute walk from the centre of florence.
Reviews.Author: ajtoynebeesmith

Reviews.Content: Umm Never Again Our small tour group of 14 stayed here this past month in June 2008 for two nights. The Jolly Carlton is in the process of major renovations. Scaffolding and cloth cover about 70 % of the windows. It took me three different room changes over a period of one night to find a working AC to cool the room. 35 degrees cel. ( 85 to 90 degrees farenheit was more than we could bear). If you have to stay here, best bet is a bottom floor since heat rises. At one point, others in our tour group had no hot water and soon after my own 10 year old son took a bath in brown water that was clearly from rusty pipes. The mgmt. did not seem too alarmed by this. We won't stay here again. If you must, wait until the renovations are done and perhaps these problems will be fixed. The lobby and restaurant is newly renovated, looks nice and were the most comfortable parts of the hotel. The Jolly Carlton advertises itself as a 4 star hotel, which in my experience was not correct given our stay and the mutilple difficutlites we experienced.
Reviews.Author: josiah97

Reviews.Content: Big Disappointment!! My wife and I stayed at the Jolly the week of May 26th with a group and the group consensus was this was the worst hotel we stayed at in two weeks.The restaurant has no ambience and poor food.The bar only opens occasionally when they feel like it. The floor we were on was recently renovated but nothing worked..no instructions on how to work the TV,telephone,safe,etc.The worst thing though was the staff was rude at the front desk and could not be bothered to help us with anything!Take your business elsewhere..the location is loud and noisy too!
Reviews.Author: Mr.Buffett

Reviews.Content: Nice room but too hot when the air con doesnt work first impression good though very much a 60's style hotel . I had a large room with a small balcony and marble bathroom. The room was clean, the bed comfortable and the staff were friendly, all plus points. The location is ok too its a nice walk into town along the Arno. Now the down side the air conditioning really didn't work I had a room facing the park, the river and the sun. the coolest it got was 24 degrees mostly settled at 26.5 degrees far from pleasant. Then there was the disco in the park on 2 evenings with throbing bass until the wee small hours.
Reviews.Author: EugeneLondon

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, Good (not great) Location We stayed at the Jolly Hotel Florence in late March on a Globus tour The hotel is located near the train station at the edge of the historic area, which means you have a 15 minute walk or bus ride to get to the center of the city. The room was small but nice, the hotel common areas were nice, the breakfast buffet was very good and the staff was friendly and helpful. Internet was too expensive so we didn't use it but there was an internet cafe a 5 minute walk away towards the train station where broadband was 2 euros for an hour. I'd rate it a 3 star hotel. Would have preferred to be closer to the center of the historic district but overall, everything was just fine.
Reviews.Author: RFD

Reviews.Content: Spacious Room This hotel very nice. The room was spacious had a small balcony. The bathroom was beautiful and the staff was friendly. The lobby was huge and was a good place to relax.
Reviews.Author: eganmay

Reviews.Content: OK. A fairly standard corporate hotel. The reception is fairly grand, but our room was fairly small, and the decor was a bit dated. It was very clean and air conditioned though, with everything in it that we needed. The location was ok, not brilliant. It is on the edge of town, so took us about 15 minutes to walk into the centre of Florence, but it was a nice walk along the river.As a word of warning, there is a park nearby where they seem to have concerts at weekends. The music was fairly loud until about 3am or 4am, and it did keep us awake.We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and had got a deal on Expedia so were fairly happy overall. However, if you are expecting 4 star, and paying 4 star prices, we wouldn't recommend it.There is a very nice restaurant just around the corner called Nanamuta's - we'd recommend that!
Reviews.Author: MissHoliday

Reviews.Content: Good Place If You Don't Mind a Short Walk       Bed
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Jolly Good       The Bathroom (sorry no photo of the room... but its nice!)
Reviews.Author: mitchmaker

Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel .... Stayed at this hotel as part of a Globus tour. It was horrendous. The room smelled nasty, the front desk was rude, the breakfasts (and one included dinner) were awful and worst of all, all the staff was rude and unhelpful. It's really a shame, because the tour itself was great and the other hotels were excellent. Globus dropped the ball on this one! I would never stay here again.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Only Average We stayed at the Jolly Hotel as part of a Globus tour in October for two nights. Our room was fairly large, with two twin beds and a sitting area with a table and two wingback chairs. The bathroom was huge and had both a standup shower and full bath, bidet, toilet and double sinks. It was very clean and the housekeeping staff were very prompt when we asked for extra pillows.The lobby is very impressive, and we found the service at the front desk to be good. There is internet access in the lobby if you buy a card. The wait staff in the breakfast room seemed a little stressed, I think they are understaffed. Globus always uses this hotels for their tours, so you would think the hotel management could deal with this a little better. The location of the hotel is not ideal, it is about a 20-30 minute walk at my pace along the river, it is quite scenic however. As for the area, we found it to be fine. We wandered all around and found many cheap restaurants a little north of the hotel, in an area that seems to be the real Florence where people live and not the touristy centre where you have to pay an arm and a leg to eat anything. In all, we found it to be a good hotel that was a little farther out than is ideal.
Reviews.Author: Leo66

Reviews.Content: Anything but Jolly!!       hotel room - view #1
Reviews.Author: SAS13

Reviews.Content: Ok but not great The plus points for this hotel are:Rooms were cleanNice lobbyGood location-20 minutes into the main tourist part of FlorenceGreat bathroomNot so good:No room service until 6:30Make sure you ask for a quiet room as the first one we were put in was VERY loud-traffic and nightclubPoor restuarant in the hotel-very little vegetarian/vegan options. Had one good meal there. Staff helpful but not too friendlyPoor choice of English speaking moviesAll in all it was perfectly fine hotel to stay in but if you are looking for something special or a bit extra look elsewhere
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Ignore Those Other Reviews No, don't - but, consider that we had an amazing experience at Jolly. Other reviewers wrote about noise and walking - we did not experience the noise (our room did not face the park), and we did not find the walks to be bad at all. We were there in the heart of summer, but walked 15-20 minutes to the city with no problem. And, the walk along the water is rather nice, I might add. Don't be sent astray - this is a great hotel.
Reviews.Author: skip2mylou

Reviews.Content: Average We stayed at the Jolly for 3 nights in July. The lobby was very welcoming although the hotel staff seemed inconvenienced by any type of question. It's very true that the bus stop is close to the hotel, but it doesn't always take you where you want to go. We asked the hotel staff for a bus route map and they said it didn't exist. They just told us to get on the 1 bus and it would take us wherever we needed to go (which is didn't!). But I digress...The room was ok for a European room. For some reason it felt a little spooky to me at night, but that's probably the result of too many Stephen King books. We never had any problems with noise at night, so I'm not sure what the other reviewers are talking about. Although we were so tired by the end of the day, we wouldn't have heard anything!The location of the hotel was disappointing. As another reviewer mentioned, the hotel is not centrally located. Stay somewhere else if you don't want to walk far.The cleaning staff did a very good job. Although, we arrived and the 2 twin beds were separate which they should not have been (we were on our honeymoon). I called the front desk to request that the beds be made into a queen size, but the request was never fulfilled. I moved the beds together every night, and you would have thought that the cleaning staff would have gotten the point that we wanted the beds together. But no, every day they separated and made up as 2 twin beds.After staying in Rome for 6 days with a mediocre breakfast, we were thrilled with the breakfast at the Jolly. They had wonderful jams and jellies. And unlike the other hotels we stayed at, the scrambled eggs were made perfectly.Anyway, the hotel was fine, but we wouldn't stay there again just due to the location.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Place Location was great - away from major tourist spots - but walkable (10 block to the Ponte Vecchio). Hotel is one short block from the Arno, there is a very pleasont neighborhood across the river. Bus access is great. Room was wonderful, clean comfortable beds, and an incredible bathroom, plus a balcony from which we could see the river. Lobby was nice to hang out in. Breakfast was OK, not great. Only complaint was the outragous price of the extra services, like laundry and meals at the hotel. I would stay there again. Oh, yea, the disco. 2 of the 5 nights we stayed there were very loud, but one of them was New Years Eve, so we didn't care. But, I would not want the windows open on those nights.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Do not recommend this Hotel because..... We stayed at this Hotel for 5 days in June, 03 and all 3 of us found the staff at reception desk quite indifferent. This is obviously a popular hotel for American tour groups; too bad that the staff doesn't seem to appreciate the business. The rooms are acceptable for European standard. Quite noisy at night as there's a disco/bar directly downstairs. Also, it's not true that it's within walking distance to Ponte Vecchio and city center. Yes, you can walk there, but it takes a good 25-30 min., by which time you're all hot and sweaty. You maybe tired already, but then it's time for you to really start walking either to museums or other interesting sites. The upside is that you're not going to gain any weight from all that gelato and pasta, because you're forever walking and walking. Also, shopping is difficult as it's not possible for you to drop off purchases at Hotel and come back out again. Your hotel is really in Siberia, the last hotel in Florence before you hit the railroad tracks!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: good location We stayed here for two nights in Sept. 2003 and the staff were very helpful and willing to please the guests. Hotel has an internet connection too. room was quite small but clean and confortable. You can walk to any of the major attractions from the hotel. Noise was a real problem at night as there must be an outdoor disco or bar with very loud music outside nearby. On one of the nights it played until 5:00am. Ask for a room in the rear of the hotel
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Nice Lobby Shame About the Room Stayed 2 nights at the hotel. First impression was good - nice lobby and staff. Room was very small, just about big enough for the double bed. We were very lucky, and had a balcony, which helped with the size of the actual room and tiny bathroom. Pity there was no furniture on it! We used the chairs from the bedroom which wasn't ideal. Room appeared to have suffered from dampness or flooding at some point, and needed refurbishing badly - carpet was stained in addition to stained and peeling paper in one corner(behind one of the chairs!) We only had breakfast on the second morning, which was nice, but rather expensive at 17EUR per person. The staff were helpful when we had any questions or needed directions, and the location is good, but our room didn't look like the ones in the ad. Not worth 4* rating. If you are staying more than a couple of nights, look elsewhere.
Reviews.Author: sheila099
